description:
Job title

Software Engineer - Intern

Reports to

IT Director
Job purpose
Emergency Care Partners has outgrown the ability to utilize the current IT/DevOps team for Tier-1 support. We need to implement, control, and manage a multi-tier model. This will be a multi-tiered support system that will allow for an IT intern(s) to process level 1 (Tier-1) support. An escalation process will be in place for additional detailed troubleshooting and support. This will allow for the current DevOps team to use their training and skillset for projects that match ECP strategic objectives.
Duties and responsibilities
· Laptop/Desktop setup and maintenance

· Various computer peripheral installation/maintenance, Network hook ups and hardware support

· Cloud Services infrastructure and architecture support

· Work with data elements from our hospital and billing repositories

· New User Account Set-up in Microsoft Office 365 and maintenance of licenses

· Various IT related tasks w/ some General Office Duty assistance

· Setting up users for different applications used internally like Dropbox

· Software Installation

· A/V set-up/tear-down for conferences

Qualifications
Education

Enrollment in technical school or 4-year college
Major in Computer Technology or related field

Additional Responsibilities:

· BI dashboards using latest technologies like Tableau

· Creating and sending MS Excel reports to executive team

· Assist in data validation and data

Abilities:

· Must be able to travel as needed

Direct reports

To be determined based on operational support needs.

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Benefits:

Paid time off

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Facebook Reality Lab (FRL) has a mission to build the AR/VR ecosystem that helps people feel connected, anytime, anywhere. As the cellular firmware team , we integrate the latest and best performing wireless technology solutions in the cellular industry. We design and develop cellular connectivity features to optimize and enhance user experiences .We’re a diverse group of problem solvers driven by a culture of experimentation and innovation
We are seeking an intern to support applications and tools development for cellular connectivity modules for future AR/VR products.

Our internships are twelve (12) to sixteen (16) weeks long, and we have various start dates throughout the year.

In this role you will be a part of the cellular firmware team responsible for feature design and development of cellular modules targeting performance, power and usability improvement for AR/VR products.
Build apps and tools to improve productivity and efficiency.
Work with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and meet the needs from the factory, hardware team and compliance team.

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong programming skills in C/C++, Java, Kotlin or Python
Experience with embedded software development
Interpersonal skills: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with Android HAL, frameworks and app development
Experience with LTE/NR L1 feature design, development and testing
Familiarity of 5G (NR) and 4G (LTE) technologies
Basic understanding of consumer hardware development including RF, antenna

Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) focuses on delivering Facebook's vision through Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR). The compute performance and power efficiency requirements of Virtual and Augmented Reality require custom silicon.

The Facebook Silicon team is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, sensors, and new ways to map the human body. Our chips will enable AR and VR devices where our real and virtual world will mix and match throughout the day. We believe the only way to achieve our goals is to look at the entire stack, from transistor, through architecture, to firmware, and algorithms. We are seeking an Embedded Software Engineer to support development of ASICs custom-designed for Facebook Reality Labs products. The successful candidate will be part of a team that includes algorithm, user experience, software, firmware and silicon experts. The ideal candidate will understand low-level embedded software development for custom low-power SoC.

Support development of ASICs custom-designed for Facebook Reality Labs products
End-to-system firmware development to include power-management, boot loaders, scheduling, RTOS and/or bare-metal implementations
Develop OS custom kernel drivers and APIs for hardware accelerators and peripherals

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering, or related field
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Hands-on coding experience with peripherals such as USB, UART, SPI, CSI/DSI, I2C, GPIO
Experience in software design and programming in C/C++ for development, debugging, testing and performance analysis

Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Experience in understanding hardware, clock-level issues, bridges, delays, interrupts, clock gating, polling etc.
Experience with lab instrumentation like oscilloscope, logic/protocol analyzers for debugging embedded systems at HW level
Experience with Computer Vision and/or Machine Learning

BNSF Logistics is a technology and people-driven third-party logistics company that delivers what matters – to our people, our customers, our carriers, and our communities. BNSF Logistics is a place where diverse talent works together every day in an inclusive way to create and implement the best ideas to help us DELIVER WHAT MATTERS. We achieve this through our commitment to our Guiding Principles which helps us create the ultimate competitive advantage in the marketplace.

We PROTECT THE WELL-BEING OF OURSELVES AND OTHERS

The Information Technology (Application Development) intern will rotate throughout the various teams within our IT Application development department during the course of this 10-week experience. University Technology Incubator Intern - Spring 2022

Capital One is a diversified bank that offers a broad array of financial products and services to consumers, small businesses and commercial clients. A Fortune 500 company, Capital One has one of the most widely recognized brands in America and is one of the nation's top 10 largest banks based on deposits.

The Capital One Tech Incubator focuses on research and experimentation in computer science. A variety of software development groups within Capital One provide students with opportunities to contribute to innovative projects. Projects may involve development for web, tools, large scale data analytics, ML/AI/NLP, SQL/NoSQL databases, open source, cyber security, automation or mobile apps.

Capital One is seeking applicants for the Spring of 2022.

This is a paid internship that is part time, requiring 10-20 hours per week. Interns will work remotely throughout the entire internship.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or higher obtained between December 2023 and August 2025 from University of Maryland, College Park or University of Illinois, Urbana Champaign

Preferred Qualifications

Currently earning a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field of study

At least 1 year of experience with Python, Java, Javascript, or C/C++

At least 1 year of experience with relational databases

At least 1 year of experience with large scale data analytics

At least 1 year of experience with AWS

At least 1 year of experience with machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing

Overview:
START YOUR JOURNEY AT GM FINANCIAL’S SUMMER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM

GM Financial was founded as Americredit in September 1992 and opened its first branch office in Fort Worth, Texas. On October 10, 2010, Americredit Corp. was acquired by General Motors Company and renamed General Motors Financial Company, Inc. (GM Financial). GM Financial is the captive auto finance company and subsidiary of General Motors and is headquartered in Fort Worth, U.S. We are a global provider of auto finance solutions, with operations in North America, South America and Asia.

GM Financial offers many unique opportunities to talented emerging professionals in our Summer Internship Program. As an intern at our company, you’ll gain hands-on, real-world experience alongside industry-leading professionals during the 10-week program. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a professional environment and build a strong foundation for your future career.
Responsibilities:
We are looking for students who are ready to take on stimulating projects and gain exposure to a variety of industry initiatives. Our program offers:
10 weeks of work experience
Competitive salary
Executive and peer networking opportunities
Independent and team project experiences
Philanthropic activities
Career development
Opportunity to apply for full-time career positions
Qualifications:
Must be a current student pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited college or university in Accounting, Business, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field with at least one semester remaining upon start of the internship.
Must possess a minimum of a 3.0 (out of a 4 point scale) overall GPA.
Junior or Senior classification preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills required. This incumbent will be required to give presentations and communicate with business leaders.
Strong analytical, quantitative, problem solving and conceptual skills required.
Must be detail oriented and able to prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.
Must be able to work independently or in a team setting.
Previous internships considered a plus.
Working Conditions:
Must be able to commit to work 40 hours for 10 consecutive weeks during the summer (First week of June through 2nd week in August)
Must participate in all GMF sponsored events for interns.
GM Financial does not provide sponsorship for a work visa status for this position.

About this Job

MotionPoint is seeking software engineer interns to work 16 to 32 hours per week for 10 weeks during the Spring (January 31 – April 8) or Summer of 2022 (May 31 – August 5) at our corporate offices in Coconut Creek, Florida. Due to Covid-19, the internship will start as remote work and may convert to onsite work at our corporate office later in the Internship. The intern will report to a software engineering manager. This is an excellent opportunity for individuals interested in Software Engineering careers. Highlights include:

Paid internship with competitive wages of $24/hr.
Professional software development work environment.
Casual work environment.
Open-door management policy.
Potential full-time employment.

Responsibilities will include hands-on, real-world tasks and projects that will have a direct impact on the ongoing growth of our company:

Develop code for application in cloud platform using Java, JavaScript, Python and SQL.
Participate in development agile planning and prioritization.
Create and maintain continuous integration and development processes.
Implement infrastructure as code (IaC) and use DevOps tools to manager cloud infrastructure.
Participate in daily Software Development team standup meetings.

Learning Objectives:

Learn how to use version control (Git/SVN).
Learn agile methods (Scrum/Kanban).
Learn Continuous Integration Technologies (Jenkins)
Learn Software Testing methods (Unit and Integration Testing).
Use mainstream technologies in a professional setting (Java, JavaScript, Python, SQL, HTML, CSS).

Qualifications:

Current college students or graduates in Computer Science or Software Engineering with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Completed courses in Intermediate Programming (Programming II or similar) and Data Structures with at least a B grade.
At least 50 completed college credits before the start of the internship (Junior or Senior level).
Ability to code in functional or Object-Oriented Programming language. (Java/JavaScript/Python/Groovy).
Knowledge of OOP, Data Structures, Unix, and SQL.
Strong consideration given to candidates that have completed a Software Testing course. Equivalent to Florida CEN 4072.

About MotionPoint Corporation

MotionPoint’s technology and processes solve the operational complexity and cost of website localization.

MotionPoint’s mission is to help brands reach, engage and serve new customers around the world. Our technology and processes solve the operational complexity and cost of website localization. We work with leading brands like AT&T, Urban Outfitters and jetBlue Airways. The real challenge of website translation isn't language-it's technology. MotionPoint's industry-leading approach eliminates the numerous technical challenges, making it effortless for brands to launch and operate translated sites in global markets. We optimize those sites for organic search and user experience, too.

About Us:

Perlman Clinic is a growing primary and urgent care provider with many locations in sunny San Diego, California. We’re looking for a software engineer intern to join our team building PocketDoc — a B2B platform providing telemedicine and online scheduling for multiple different healthcare providers. You’ll be working directly with stakeholders to define and build products that have a positive impact on the health and wellbeing of our patients. This position is local in Hillcrest, San Diego.

We’re looking to hire a talented software engineer intern to help grow our small team and deliver fantastic tools to our patients and providers. You’ll be working directly with stakeholders and the engineering team to research and build new tools and features. You will also have the opportunity to help refactor existing parts of our codebase as we move towards automating more and more of our processes.

What you’ll be doing:

Help improve patient access to timely healthcare using PocketDoc. We’re constantly researching new ways we can improve the care our Providers can give patients directly from the app.
Drive adoption of accessible online scheduling allowing patients to schedule on their own without having to pick up the telephone.
Dive deep into the world of insurance to provide automation and tooling to make it easier to verify eligibility and ensure patients can get the care they need.
You’ll have plenty of latitude to research and implement features on the DevOps front as we work to automate more processes and build our existing infrastructure. We’re focused on simplicity first and introducing more complex processes as we reach our limits.
Helping to mentor junior developers is a crucial part of this role. You’ll be doing some pair-programming, code reviews, and be the all-knowing-eye-of-sauron (or at least a very helpful resource) for the team.

Who you are:

You’re looking for a role where you’re spending most of your day programming and solving problems. We have a very light project management system and are focused on actually solving problems, not just writing about them.
You’re all-in on effective communication and getting to know your peers. We’re focused on building a team that meshes well and brings experiences from all walks of life.
Professional experience building and shipping software for the web and/or mobile devices. We’re a heavy user of React for our frontends, but any experience working with modern JS development practices is sufficient.
You get excited about working in a well-structured codebase and are ready to bring your previous experiences to the table to make it even better.
You’re familiar with typed languages of any variety — TypeScript, Go, Rust, you name it — and are excited to dig deeper and build out strong API backends using Go.

Benefits:

We’re a stable, private company that focuses on what is best for our users without the need to grow at all costs. We are focused on building a stable product that brings tangible benefits to our users.
We believe in solving real problems for our users and providing tools that help healthcare companies grow and better serve their patients.
You'll have the latitude needed to dive deep into issues, make recommendations on process improvements, and talk with users of PocketDoc to help make informed decisions.

The nitty gritty:

Our frontends are written using React & Typescript, deployed automatically using GitHub actions. Our mobile app is built on React Native (with Typescript) with automated CodePush deployments through GitHub actions.
Our backend API is written in Go and hosted in AWS. Data is stored in MongoDB and we use Firebase for some real-time data.
Twilio and Postmarkapp power our communication channels with Patients. We use WebRTC to power face-to-face video chats between Providers and Patients.
We integrate directly with EPIC EMR (Electronic Medical Records system) to look up patient information and handle the scheduling internals.

Job Type: Full-time

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance

Health insurance

Paid time off

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

What was your school GPA?
How many years of software development experience do you have?

position: Optical Engineer Intern, Eye Tracking Image Quality
description:
The eye tracking team is working to advance the state of human tracking technologies by designing and implementing eye tracking software in a broad range of eye tracking research applications. Working closely with expert Scientists, Mechanical Engineers, Electrical Engineers and Software Engineers you will help create cutting-edge research prototypes that explore the future of virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR). You will be responsible for designing, developing and testing new software algorithms for eye tracking and gaze estimation applications using a variety of sensor modalities. In addition, you will take part in simulating, analyzing, testing, and reporting on potential software and hardware solutions. Join the adventure of a lifetime as we make science fiction real and change the world.

Eye tracking requires the co-development of hardware and software algorithms. Come work at the intersection of these two technologies to help the team define better hardware and image quality metrics based on algorithm needs.

Our internships are twelve (12) to sixteen (16) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.

Work closely with both the Eye Tracking Hardware and Algorithms teams to determine the impact of hardware performance and image quality on algorithm performance
Develop a simulation pipeline to predict algorithm performance based on hardware performance

Currently has, or in the process of obtaining, an MS or PhD in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science or related field
Interest and/or experience working at the intersection of of hardware and software
Proficiency in high-level programming languages such as Matlab, Python and/or C++
Experience communicating and presenting technical work in a clear and concise way
Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Image processing, machine learning, and/or algorithm development experience
Optical modeling experience
Experience in consumer electronic product design field
Familiar with image quality metrics and having hands on experience of image quality evaluation and tuning for computer vision is a plus
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship

***This position is for an intern who will be entering their Junior year by the start of Summer 2022***

Raytheon Missiles and Defense (RMD) is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets where you’ll be part of a global team working together to solve some of the most demanding challenges on the planet. We are the world's largest developer, producer and integrator of weapon systems. In fact, we've produced over one million missiles in our history. Military forces in more than 50 countries look to us for a high-quality product portfolio that includes missiles, smart munitions, projectiles, kinetic kill vehicles and directed energy weapons. We are able to accomplish this feat because our employees live our Values of Trust, Respect, Collaboration, Innovation and Accountability. Diversity is a part of our culture and a key to our success. When world-class talent works together in a place that is respectful and inclusive, we solve some of the world's hardest problems.

We know that a diverse company is a strong company. The people of Raytheon Technologies come from different backgrounds. We value our different perspectives and styles of tackling the world’s most complex challenges and toughest threats. Through Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), our employees are empowered to impact business results, build professional networks, advocate for causes that matter to them and contribute to their local communities. Diversity of thought is critical to the future of innovation. We leverage these unique voices to generate solutions toward a united and singular purpose: to define the future of aerospace.

U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position needs an active U.S. Security Clearance as of day one of employment.

Qualifications You Must Have:
Must be a Junior, Senior, or Post-Graduate standing by Summer 2022 in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) from an ABET, Including specific majors: Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, Computer Science, Engineering Science, Robotics, or related scientific or STEM discipline with a minimum 3.00 cumulative GPA required.
Applied engineering experience or coursework with exposure in one or more of the following domains: Systems Engineering, Software or Firmware development, Systems Integration and/or Test, ASIC development, Cybersecurity, System Security, Digital Electronics design, or similar work history.
U.S. Citizenship Required

Desired Skills and Experience:
Active Department of Defense clearance

Experience in design, development and fielding of secure systems for military applications: “relevant experience” is knowledge of a broad array of program protection concepts, reverse engineering tools and techniques, failure analysis, and cryptography.

CAMP Systems is the leading provider of aircraft compliance and health management services to the global business aviation industry. CAMP is the pre-eminent brand in its industry and is the exclusive recommended service provider for virtually all of the business aircraft manufacturers in the world including Gulfstream, Boeing, Bombardier, Cessna, Dassault, Embraer, Beechcraft, Socata, Pilatus, HondaJet as well as Pratt & Whitney Canada and Honeywell. Our Story:
Founded in 2008, Hightower Advisors is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations, and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. Life as a Hightower Intern:
Our Interns have the chance to learn more about Hightower’s culture and businesses while developing practical skills necessary for future success and post-graduate opportunities. The program culminates with a final presentation given to Hightower executives, managers, and fellow interns where you will highlight your experience.

Attend workshops related post-college career paths and personal development

Develop a comprehensive understanding of specific team and department initiatives and goal

Platform and innovation provide CRM and integration services to our advisor teams and corporate users. We deliver high quality applications the processes for existing teams and also attract new acquisitions by offering flexible services they cannot achieve on their own.

Adaptability. You have the instinctive need to achieve objectives despite the hurdles that may come along the way. You are ready to join a fast-paced environment and are adaptable to constant change.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

At the heart of Defining Possible is our commitment to missions. In rapidly changing global security environments, Northrop Grumman brings informed insights and software-secure technology to enable strategic planning. We’re looking for innovators who can help us keep building on our wide portfolio of secure, affordable, integrated, and multi-domain systems and technologies that fuel those missions. By joining in our shared mission, we’ll support yours of expanding your personal network and developing skills, whether you are new to the field or an industry thought-leader. Help to develop automation capabilities in a network environment using primarily Ansible, for data collection and automation of network operations processes (e.g. involving network routers, switches, firewalls etc.). Research and test other automation tools, including determining fitness for a network environment and integration with existing toolset. Basic software development experience used to develop applications using Python, JavaScript and other tools based on requirements
Use GitLab for code management including bug tracking, testing and push to production

Create and/or update documentation / instructions as directed

Good presentation and writing/communication skills.

Familiarity with Linux operating system (package installation/removal, file permissions, network configuration, shell environment etc.)
Powershell, MongoDB, Ansible, Git

Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 92 million registered learners as of Sept. 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 250 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

Coursera’s Engineering teams are responsible for maintaining a scalable and reliable platform. Engineering works to build interactive products for the worldwide learner community. As an engineer at Coursera, you will be empowered to build well-engineered products that shape new platform features and advance our technical infrastructure. You will be encouraged to build reliable, scalable, testable, and efficient systems.

During the 12 weeks internship, you'll be embedded as a member of a small Engineering team and paired with a mentor on your team. You will have the guidance, environment, and the responsibility of deploying your projects to production. You will work on real projects, features, and updates that will affect millions of learners worldwide!

Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!

Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree or program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship

Currently pursuing a B.A./B.S. Degree or higher in Computer Science, or related technical field
Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, school projects or coding competitions.
Self-motivated, smart, hands-on, relentlessly focused on impact, and able to operate under a great deal of independence

We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. PayPal’s Global Data Sciences team is responsible for developing and enhancing machine learning and data mining capabilities, which are key in PayPal’s top-of-the-line data-driven decisions. We are a group of data scientists and problem solvers with strong analytical, mathematical, and programming skills and like to approach various kinds of challenges in complex environments. Develop and validate advance data mining tools, algorithms, and other capabilities to solve business problem.

Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

position: Software Engineering Internship - Mobile Robotics / Tesla Bot (Summer 2022)
description:
Disclaimer: This position is expected to start around May or June 2022 and continue through the entire Summerterm (i.e. through August/Septemeber) or into Fall 2022 if available. We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time, for most internships. Please consider before applying.

International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week. Many students will be limited to part-time depending on their academic standing.

Internship Program at Tesla

The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions where they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their manager, mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by giving them projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission.

About the team

Tesla’s Mobile Robotics team designs and builds humanoid bi-pedal robots (Tesla Bot) to automate repetitive tasks and wheeled robots for manufacturing and autonomous logistics. The team joins mechanical, electrical, controls, software, and manufacturing engineering disciplines in a highly collaborative team

The Mobile Robotics team is seeking highly motivated software engineering interns who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to apply engineering concepts to real world projects. As a software engineering intern within the Mobile Robotics group, you’ll have the opportunity to work with incredibly talented engineers who are responsible for many of Tesla’s innovations.

Location:

Palo Alto, CA

What to Expect:

Qualified applicants may be reviewed by one or more of the following teams:

Controls Engineering: The controls challenge in designing a fully autonomous robot includes robust dynamic and kinematic modeling, stabilization control architecture, optimal reference trajectory generation and tracking, disturbance avoidance, implementation in embedded systems and more. The ideal candidate will have an interest in modeling and control of multi DOF robots for use in real world applications.

Server/Robotic Interaction Software Engineering: We are looking for an engineering intern that will help build the server-side/robotic interaction software stack for Tesla Bot. Your contributions will automate end-to-end registration, movement, action management, job assignment, as well as the remote operation of these bots. The team builds a suite of applications that include: fleet management, mobile apps, video streaming, in addition to AR/VR apps that will help the team control, train, and orchestrate these bots.

Autonomy Engineering: Core to the Tesla Bot and wheeled vehicle’s full autonomy, the perception stack presents a unique opportunity to work on state-of-the-art algorithms for state estimation and motion planning, culminating in their deployment to real world production applications. The perception software engineer intern will help develop this stack from inception to deployment. The ideal candidate will have an interest in developing humanoid bi-pedal robot perception solutions for commercial applications.

Firmware Engineering: As a member of the hardware / embedded controls team, you will help design, layout and implement hardware interfaces and control loops to new Tesla products, using in-house hardware and proprietary bus systems.

Requirements:

Currently working towards a BS, MS, or advanced degree in a relevant engineering program such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering

Experience in one or more of the following developer skills: C++, Python, MATLAB/Simulink or other common industry languages

Eagerness to collaborate cross-functionally with other engineering teams while able to work independently; detail-oriented and execution focused

Genuine curiosity and willingness to understand how our products are designed, built and how they operate
Show more

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly motivated graduate-level student intern with a strong background in solving analytical problems to join our team at the Climate Corporation. You will help develop methodology to build predictive agronomic models incorporating key data layers such as soil, vegetation, water resources, weather, environmental characteristics, and crop yield by leveraging the latest in data science, geospatial analytics, and remote sensing tools. If you are interested in applying your skills in data to help farmers, The Climate Corporation would love to talk to you!

What You Will Do:

Develop/validate/refine predictive disease (zero-inflated and hurdle) models using techniques in statistical modeling, optimization modeling, and machine learning
Explore and mine large and diverse agricultural data sets
Collaborate with other data scientists to develop models, test techniques, and resolve issues
Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results to cross functional groups

Basic Qualifications:

Pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Biostatistics, Epidemiology or related quantitative discipline from an academic institution
Experience with Python and/or R
A course in calculus-based statistics
Ability to work in a cross-functional environment, with strong interpersonal and written and oral communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Skilled in use of Python and/or R for research
Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills and a drive to understand and derive meaningful insights from data and results
Experience applying statistical methodology to real-world problems
Experience manipulating and analyzing large data sets and performing exploratory data analysis and modeling
Experience with statistical modeling of epidemiologic data
Experience with linear models and generalized linear models
An understanding of and/or experience with zero-inflated and hurdle models

Our environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with a diverse set of top engineers, agronomists, and statisticians working together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers.

We offer competitive pay and perks.
We provide meals and a large assortment of snacks and drinks to get you through the day.
You’ll get 1:1 mentoring from a talented and motivated employee on your team.
You’ll have the opportunity to work on real projects with experienced employees and have a direct impact on the company. (Our internships are not summer camp!)
You’ll work in an award winning office with smart designs, large common areas and open floor plans that fuel collaboration.
You’ll attend various company sponsored events, activities and off-sites - we make sure interns are having fun!
We regularly host meet-up groups and tech-talks and encourage participation in relevant workshops and conferences
You’ll have the opportunity to interact with key executives and leadership.

We also hinge our cultural DNA on these five values:

Inspire one another
Innovate in all we do
Leave a mark on the world
Find the possible in the impossible
Be direct and transparent

Learn more about our team and our mission:

The Climate Corporation - The Technology Behind Making A Difference

https://youtu.be/_6DOwEjRI2o or visit https://climate.com/careers

Climate aims to create a welcoming and collaborative environment for our employees in which a diverse set of perspectives and voices are represented and celebrated.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, The Climate Corporation is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, sex (including pregnancy), protected veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any unlawful criterion existing under applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@climate.com.

description:
ViacomCBS (NASDAQ: VIAC; VIACA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, ViacomCBS provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.

In the ViacomCBS Summer Internship Program, interns will be working in a vibrant and inclusive environment alongside employees from different backgrounds. Through our in-depth offerings, interns gain exposure across our business while making significant connections for their future and accessing exciting career opportunities. In addition to hands-on experience our programs include networking, mentorship, resume workshops, speaker sessions, career development, visibility to top industry executives, and much more.

Our summer internship opportunities include (but are not limited to) the below. Interested candidates should submit their application no later than Friday, December 31st. If you’re selected for an interview, you’ll be notified by a member of the recruiting team.

ViacomCBS Streaming, a division of ViacomCBS Inc., oversees the company’s streaming technology and is comprised of world-renowned direct-to-consumer services across free, premium and pay including, Pluto TV, the leading free streaming television service in America with 250+ live and original channels, and Paramount+, a subscription service that combines breaking news, live sports, and premium entertainment.

The ViacomCBS Streaming ecosystem also includes award-winning news services such as, CBSN, CBS News’ 24/7 digital streaming news service; CBS Sports HQ, the 24/7 streaming sports news network; and ET Live, a free 24/7 direct-to-consumer streaming network dedicated to all things entertainment.

Build high-level user interfaces using rapid prototyping methodologies. Work with internal technical teams to identify and build platform elements required. Support on any number of platforms like Xbox, LG TVs, Samsung TVs, Comcast Flex, etc. Standard sprint ceremonies - scrum, planning, grooming, retro, etc. Front-End Software Development for High Traffic, Streaming Web Property. API development, Video Packaging technology improvements, Documentation and internal tools development. Development of automated test scripts through Java language and open-source solutions.

Basic Qualifications: Studying Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent. Programming experience/working knowledge with programming languages such as: Front End: HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, Vue, Angular Backend: PHP, Python, Node, Golang, Java Mobile: Swift, Objective-C, Android SDK, Kotlin, RXJava

Additional Qualifications: Sound programming fundamentals: memory management, pointers, arrays, and dictionaries, systems. Understanding of fundamental computer science concepts, algorithms, and data structures. Knowledge of common software development methodologies like Test-Driven Development and Scrum.

The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?

At Honeywell, we are blending physical products with software solutions to link people and businesses to the information they need to be more efficient, more productive, and more connected. We have a real passion for the place where
physical meets digital. In this emerging Internet of Things era, the world is moving from simple digital transactions to complex digital-to-physical interfaces. It is here where sensor data from connected devices meet our domain expertise and your Data Science skills to enable solutions like:

Technologies for connected buildings improving comfort and energy efficiency
The world's most advanced cockpits, jet engines, auxiliary power units,
turbochargers, along with their efficient maintenance

Refining and petrochemicals process technologies and controls
Voice-automated systems
Personal protective equipment for connected workers
Your time with Honeywell could be spent in any of the following ways:

Extracting, transforming, and loading data in preparation for analysis
Engineering features incorporating domain expertise and statistical aggregations
Developing and evaluating statistical inference models based on those features, solving a costumer’s problem.
Deploying analytic solutions to production platforms, ready to be used in one of Honeywell’s products or services.
Some frameworks we use are: Jupyter, RStudio, Flask, OpenCPU.
Some of the tools we use include Git, Docker, Bamboo, and more
Some of the databases we use are: Hive, SQL, Dremio, and Druid to name a few

Our teams live by the ‘teach and learn’ mantra. We value our more seasoned data scientists because they bring additional value to our company by using their years of experience to guide the next generation. We also value you, our young talent. We'll assign you a mentor on day one, so you can take advantage of this amazing learning opportunity. We want you to finish your internship with a much better understanding of the data science field and Honeywell. We know you'll be a better data scientist by the time this internship ends!

Must Have

Pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in Engineering or Computer Science related discipline at an accredited college or university
Have completed at least your first year of a college or university
Be able to participate in an internship prior to completing current degree program

We Value

Minimum 85% course average (3.7 GPA)
Be familiar with one or more of the following programming languages: Python, R, MatLab, Java, or C++
Insatiable appetite for learning new technologies
Committed pursuit of innovative solutions

The Facebook Silicon team is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, sensors, and new ways to map the human body. Our chips will enable AR and VR devices where our real and virtual world will mix and match throughout the day. We believe the only way to achieve our goals is to look at the entire stack, from transistor, through architecture, to firmware, and algorithms. We are seeking an Embedded Software Engineer to support development of ASICs custom-designed for Facebook Reality Labs products. The successful candidate will be part of a team that includes algorithm, user experience, software, firmware and silicon experts. The ideal candidate will understand low-level embedded software development for custom low-power SoC.

Support development of ASICs custom-designed for Facebook Reality Labs products
End-to-system firmware development to include power-management, boot loaders, scheduling, RTOS and/or bare-metal implementations
Develop OS custom kernel drivers and APIs for hardware accelerators and peripherals

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering, or related field
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Hands-on coding experience with peripherals such as USB, UART, SPI, CSI/DSI, I2C, GPIO
Experience in software design and programming in C/C++ for development, debugging, testing and performance analysis

Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Experience in understanding hardware, clock-level issues, bridges, delays, interrupts, clock gating, polling etc.
Experience with lab instrumentation like oscilloscope, logic/protocol analyzers for debugging embedded systems at HW level
Experience with Computer Vision and/or Machine Learning

About Us:

Perlman Clinic is a growing primary and urgent care provider with many locations in sunny San Diego, California. We’re looking for a software engineer intern to join our team building PocketDoc — a B2B platform providing telemedicine and online scheduling for multiple different healthcare providers. You’ll be working directly with stakeholders to define and build products that have a positive impact on the health and wellbeing of our patients. This position is local in Hillcrest, San Diego.

We’re looking to hire a talented software engineer intern to help grow our small team and deliver fantastic tools to our patients and providers. You’ll be working directly with stakeholders and the engineering team to research and build new tools and features. You will also have the opportunity to help refactor existing parts of our codebase as we move towards automating more and more of our processes.

What you’ll be doing:

Help improve patient access to timely healthcare using PocketDoc. We’re constantly researching new ways we can improve the care our Providers can give patients directly from the app.
Drive adoption of accessible online scheduling allowing patients to schedule on their own without having to pick up the telephone.
Dive deep into the world of insurance to provide automation and tooling to make it easier to verify eligibility and ensure patients can get the care they need.
You’ll have plenty of latitude to research and implement features on the DevOps front as we work to automate more processes and build our existing infrastructure. We’re focused on simplicity first and introducing more complex processes as we reach our limits.
Helping to mentor junior developers is a crucial part of this role. You’ll be doing some pair-programming, code reviews, and be the all-knowing-eye-of-sauron (or at least a very helpful resource) for the team.

Who you are:

You’re looking for a role where you’re spending most of your day programming and solving problems. We have a very light project management system and are focused on actually solving problems, not just writing about them.
You’re all-in on effective communication and getting to know your peers. We’re focused on building a team that meshes well and brings experiences from all walks of life.
Professional experience building and shipping software for the web and/or mobile devices. We’re a heavy user of React for our frontends, but any experience working with modern JS development practices is sufficient.
You get excited about working in a well-structured codebase and are ready to bring your previous experiences to the table to make it even better.
You’re familiar with typed languages of any variety — TypeScript, Go, Rust, you name it — and are excited to dig deeper and build out strong API backends using Go.

Benefits:

We’re a stable, private company that focuses on what is best for our users without the need to grow at all costs. We are focused on building a stable product that brings tangible benefits to our users.
We believe in solving real problems for our users and providing tools that help healthcare companies grow and better serve their patients.
You'll have the latitude needed to dive deep into issues, make recommendations on process improvements, and talk with users of PocketDoc to help make informed decisions.

The nitty gritty:

Our frontends are written using React & Typescript, deployed automatically using GitHub actions. Our mobile app is built on React Native (with Typescript) with automated CodePush deployments through GitHub actions.
Our backend API is written in Go and hosted in AWS. Data is stored in MongoDB and we use Firebase for some real-time data.
Twilio and Postmarkapp power our communication channels with Patients. We use WebRTC to power face-to-face video chats between Providers and Patients.
We integrate directly with EPIC EMR (Electronic Medical Records system) to look up patient information and handle the scheduling internals.

position: Optical Engineer Intern, Eye Tracking Image Quality
description:
The eye tracking team is working to advance the state of human tracking technologies by designing and implementing eye tracking software in a broad range of eye tracking research applications. Working closely with expert Scientists, Mechanical Engineers, Electrical Engineers and Software Engineers you will help create cutting-edge research prototypes that explore the future of virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR). You will be responsible for designing, developing and testing new software algorithms for eye tracking and gaze estimation applications using a variety of sensor modalities. In addition, you will take part in simulating, analyzing, testing, and reporting on potential software and hardware solutions. Join the adventure of a lifetime as we make science fiction real and change the world.

Eye tracking requires the co-development of hardware and software algorithms. Come work at the intersection of these two technologies to help the team define better hardware and image quality metrics based on algorithm needs.

Our internships are twelve (12) to sixteen (16) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.

Work closely with both the Eye Tracking Hardware and Algorithms teams to determine the impact of hardware performance and image quality on algorithm performance
Develop a simulation pipeline to predict algorithm performance based on hardware performance

Currently has, or in the process of obtaining, an MS or PhD in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Computer Science or related field
Interest and/or experience working at the intersection of of hardware and software
Proficiency in high-level programming languages such as Matlab, Python and/or C++
Experience communicating and presenting technical work in a clear and concise way
Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Image processing, machine learning, and/or algorithm development experience
Optical modeling experience
Experience in consumer electronic product design field
Familiar with image quality metrics and having hands on experience of image quality evaluation and tuning for computer vision is a plus
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship

Our Story:
Founded in 2008, Hightower Advisors is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations, and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. Hightower’s capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of “well-th. rebalanced.” Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., the firm operates as a registered investment advisor (RIA).

Life as a Hightower Intern:
Our Interns have the chance to learn more about Hightower’s culture and businesses while developing practical skills necessary for future success and post-graduate opportunities. The program includes weekly conversations with C-level professionals related to career development, networking opportunities with Hightower with fellow interns and colleagues, and engaging workshops related post-graduation skills and money management. The program culminates with a final presentation given to Hightower executives, managers, and fellow interns where you will highlight your experience.

The summer internship program is a 10-week long program aimed to provide opportunities to:

Learn directly from industry experts by having weekly 1:1 conversations related to career development
Attend workshops related post-college career paths and personal development
Gain exposure to the financial services industry
Develop a comprehensive understanding of specific team and department initiatives and goal
As an intern, you will participate in development meeting, a variety of networking, mentoring and community events, all intended to reinforce the Core Values of the Program – Education, Innovation, Leadership, Collaboration and Service.

The position is full time for the 10 weeks and is a paid, non-exempt position.

Your Future Team:
Platform and innovation provide CRM and integration services to our advisor teams and corporate users. We deliver high quality applications the processes for existing teams and also attract new acquisitions by offering flexible services they cannot achieve on their own.

What You’ll Do:

Review and document existing data structures in Salesforce environment.
Identify unused resources that can be deprecated.
Assist in data mapping/integration for new teams.
Identify redundant data patterns.
What You’ll Bring:

Adaptability. You have the instinctive need to achieve objectives despite the hurdles that may come along the way. You are ready to join a fast-paced environment and are adaptable to constant change.
Agile. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and working with competing priorities. You maintain composure and remain positive under pressure and know how to influence stakeholders even when the situation might be complex.
Team player. You love collaborating and sharing ideas. You’re ready to roll up your sleeves, trust your teammates, and support as needed.
Clear communicator. You communicate clearly and concisely. You’re great at getting and giving respectful and productive feedback to candidates and colleagues.
Highly organized. You know how to manage multiple projects and prioritize appropriately. You create clear and logical systems and processes to support your work and that of the organization.
Committed to learning. You are a current full-time, undergraduate student pursing a bachelor’s degree and have a GPA of 3.0 or above.
You are a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident or possess other unrestricted U.S. work authorization and will not require sponsorship for U.S. work authorization now or anytime in the future.

Hightower requires proof of COVID-19 vaccination for all employees. Reasonable accommodations will be considered. If an employee is unable to provide proof of vaccination, mask coverings and weekly COVID-19 testing will be implemented.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

At the heart of Defining Possible is our commitment to missions. In rapidly changing global security environments, Northrop Grumman brings informed insights and software-secure technology to enable strategic planning. We’re looking for innovators who can help us keep building on our wide portfolio of secure, affordable, integrated, and multi-domain systems and technologies that fuel those missions. By joining in our shared mission, we’ll support yours of expanding your personal network and developing skills, whether you are new to the field or an industry thought-leader. At Northrop Grumman, you’ll have the resources, support, and team to do some of the best work of your career.Your opportunities for achievement are limitless with Northrop Grumman Enterprise Services.An internship at Northrop Grumman is unique. Sure, you’ll learn new skills, explore our enterprise, network with experts, connect with thought leaders, and finish with a resume that opens doors. But you’ll gain something even more valuable: pride in what you’ve done. Join us and launch your career. We’ll support you with training, employee resource groups, and our shared vision of global security.Northrop Grumman is seeking a Software Developer to join the Enterprise Services Intern Program. This position will be virtual. Virtual positions may be filled in any US State and selection will be based on the most qualified candidate.The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Engineering Manufacturing Systems and Infrastructure (EMS&I) organization working on research and development networks. The selected candidate will work in a in a distributed team environment where he/she will assist with development of a Python-based (Flask) web application, including developing input forms and back-end logic/processing of collected inputs. Help to develop automation capabilities in a network environment using primarily Ansible, for data collection and automation of network operations processes (e.g. involving network routers, switches, firewalls etc.). Research and test other automation tools, including determining fitness for a network environment and integration with existing toolset. As an intern, you’ll participate in a summer internship program to develop competencies in a variety of software development specializations that may include:Roles and Responsibilities
Basic software development experience used to develop applications using Python, JavaScript and other tools based on requirements
Use GitLab for code management including bug tracking, testing and push to production
Ability to research, solve problems and carry out tasks with minimal supervision
Create and/or update documentation / instructions as directed
Ability to work well remotely with a virtual team
Basic QualificationsA candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:
Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2021.
Be majoring in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or related field
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2021
Have U.S. citizenship
Preferred Qualifications
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Good presentation and writing/communication skills.
Self-motivated, willing to learn, and interested in working in a team environment.
Web development (HTML, CSS). Preferably experience with any/all of Python Flask web framework, Gunicorn and NGINX
Familiarity with Linux operating system (package installation/removal, file permissions, network configuration, shell environment etc.)
Powershell, MongoDB, Ansible, Git
Exposure to basic networking (e.g. routing/switching and security)

Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 92 million registered learners as of Sept. 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 250 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

Coursera’s Engineering teams are responsible for maintaining a scalable and reliable platform. Engineering works to build interactive products for the worldwide learner community. As an engineer at Coursera, you will be empowered to build well-engineered products that shape new platform features and advance our technical infrastructure. You will be encouraged to build reliable, scalable, testable, and efficient systems.

During the 12 weeks internship, you'll be embedded as a member of a small Engineering team and paired with a mentor on your team. You will have the guidance, environment, and the responsibility of deploying your projects to production. You will work on real projects, features, and updates that will affect millions of learners worldwide!

Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!
Basic Qualifications:
Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree or program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship
Preferred Qualifications:
Currently pursuing a B.A./B.S. Degree or higher in Computer Science, or related technical field
Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, school projects or coding competitions.
Self-motivated, smart, hands-on, relentlessly focused on impact, and able to operate under a great deal of independence

Job Description:

PayPal’s Global Data Sciences team is responsible for developing and enhancing machine learning and data mining capabilities, which are key in PayPal’s top-of-the-line data-driven decisions. We are a group of data scientists and problem solvers with strong analytical, mathematical, and programming skills and like to approach various kinds of challenges in complex environments. This role offers a unique opportunity to innovate and improve PayPal’s Data Science capabilities for Risk Detection and Customer Operations.

Develop and validate advance data mining tools, algorithms, and other capabilities to solve business problem.
Collaborate with other research scientists and engineers to formulate innovative solutions to experiment and implement advanced data mining techniques
Work with large volumes of data; extract and manipulate large datasets using standard tools such as Python, Hadoop, R, SQL
Analyze data covering a wide range of information from user profile to transaction history. Identify new risk patterns through data mining
Communicate complex concepts and the results of the analyses in a clear and effective manner through creative visualization
Pursuing degree in engineering, computer science, statistics, or other related fields.
Must be earning a Masters or PhD degree

For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

This is an exciting role to work closely with the Development, Security, DevOps, and Architecture teams to develop highly scalable solutions that integrate client agents and cloud services. To be successful in this role, you are expected to be highly hands-on, have knowledge of basic software engineering concepts, and be motivated to learn new technologies.

What You'll Do
* Work with the development team to develop software solutions that can involve client and cloud components
* Implement features going through the end-to-end lifecycle from design to production release
* Review pull requests from your peers to ensure high standards, consistency, and durability of the implementation

Position Requirements:

Basic Qualifications:
* Student in engineering, computer science, or technical related discipline
* 6+ months of software development experience in Java, NodeJS, C# or Python

Preferred Qualifications:
* Knowledge of data structures, software engineering, distributed systems, and database systems
* Previous internship experience in software development companies
* Experience with working with a group of developers
* Knowledge of source control systems (Git)
* Basic experience with public Cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform)
* Knowledge of RESTful web services

Some of the benefits of interning at Lenovo include competitive compensation, enrichment and development programs, and access to a global network of peers and mentors.

position: Software Engineering Internship - Mobile Robotics / Tesla Bot (Summer 2022)
description:
Disclaimer: This position is expected to start around May or June 2022 and continue through the entire Summerterm (i.e. through August/Septemeber) or into Fall 2022 if available. We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time, for most internships. Please consider before applying.

International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week. Many students will be limited to part-time depending on their academic standing.

Internship Program at Tesla

The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions where they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their manager, mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by giving them projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission.

About the team

Tesla’s Mobile Robotics team designs and builds humanoid bi-pedal robots (Tesla Bot) to automate repetitive tasks and wheeled robots for manufacturing and autonomous logistics. The team joins mechanical, electrical, controls, software, and manufacturing engineering disciplines in a highly collaborative team

The Mobile Robotics team is seeking highly motivated software engineering interns who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to apply engineering concepts to real world projects. As a software engineering intern within the Mobile Robotics group, you’ll have the opportunity to work with incredibly talented engineers who are responsible for many of Tesla’s innovations.

Location:

Palo Alto, CA

What to Expect:

Qualified applicants may be reviewed by one or more of the following teams:

Controls Engineering: The controls challenge in designing a fully autonomous robot includes robust dynamic and kinematic modeling, stabilization control architecture, optimal reference trajectory generation and tracking, disturbance avoidance, implementation in embedded systems and more. The ideal candidate will have an interest in modeling and control of multi DOF robots for use in real world applications.

Server/Robotic Interaction Software Engineering: We are looking for an engineering intern that will help build the server-side/robotic interaction software stack for Tesla Bot. Your contributions will automate end-to-end registration, movement, action management, job assignment, as well as the remote operation of these bots. The team builds a suite of applications that include: fleet management, mobile apps, video streaming, in addition to AR/VR apps that will help the team control, train, and orchestrate these bots.

Autonomy Engineering: Core to the Tesla Bot and wheeled vehicle’s full autonomy, the perception stack presents a unique opportunity to work on state-of-the-art algorithms for state estimation and motion planning, culminating in their deployment to real world production applications. The perception software engineer intern will help develop this stack from inception to deployment. The ideal candidate will have an interest in developing humanoid bi-pedal robot perception solutions for commercial applications.

Firmware Engineering: As a member of the hardware / embedded controls team, you will help design, layout and implement hardware interfaces and control loops to new Tesla products, using in-house hardware and proprietary bus systems.

Requirements:

Currently working towards a BS, MS, or advanced degree in a relevant engineering program such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering

Experience in one or more of the following developer skills: C++, Python, MATLAB/Simulink or other common industry languages

Eagerness to collaborate cross-functionally with other engineering teams while able to work independently; detail-oriented and execution focused

Genuine curiosity and willingness to understand how our products are designed, built and how they operate

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly motivated graduate-level student intern with a strong background in solving analytical problems to join our team at the Climate Corporation. You will help develop methodology to build predictive agronomic models incorporating key data layers such as soil, vegetation, water resources, weather, environmental characteristics, and crop yield by leveraging the latest in data science, geospatial analytics, and remote sensing tools. If you are interested in applying your skills in data to help farmers, The Climate Corporation would love to talk to you!

What You Will Do:

Develop/validate/refine predictive disease (zero-inflated and hurdle) models using techniques in statistical modeling, optimization modeling, and machine learning
Explore and mine large and diverse agricultural data sets
Collaborate with other data scientists to develop models, test techniques, and resolve issues
Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results to cross functional groups

Basic Qualifications:

Pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Biostatistics, Epidemiology or related quantitative discipline from an academic institution
Experience with Python and/or R
A course in calculus-based statistics
Ability to work in a cross-functional environment, with strong interpersonal and written and oral communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Skilled in use of Python and/or R for research
Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills and a drive to understand and derive meaningful insights from data and results
Experience applying statistical methodology to real-world problems
Experience manipulating and analyzing large data sets and performing exploratory data analysis and modeling
Experience with statistical modeling of epidemiologic data
Experience with linear models and generalized linear models
An understanding of and/or experience with zero-inflated and hurdle models

Our environment is extremely engaging and fast-paced, with a diverse set of top engineers, agronomists, and statisticians working together to provide the best possible products and experiences for our customers.

We offer competitive pay and perks.
We provide meals and a large assortment of snacks and drinks to get you through the day.
You’ll get 1:1 mentoring from a talented and motivated employee on your team.
You’ll have the opportunity to work on real projects with experienced employees and have a direct impact on the company. (Our internships are not summer camp!)
You’ll work in an award winning office with smart designs, large common areas and open floor plans that fuel collaboration.
You’ll attend various company sponsored events, activities and off-sites - we make sure interns are having fun!
We regularly host meet-up groups and tech-talks and encourage participation in relevant workshops and conferences
You’ll have the opportunity to interact with key executives and leadership.

We also hinge our cultural DNA on these five values:

Inspire one another
Innovate in all we do
Leave a mark on the world
Find the possible in the impossible
Be direct and transparent

Learn more about our team and our mission:

The Climate Corporation - The Technology Behind Making A Difference

https://youtu.be/_6DOwEjRI2o or visit https://climate.com/careers

Climate aims to create a welcoming and collaborative environment for our employees in which a diverse set of perspectives and voices are represented and celebrated.
